intro: Euonymus fortunei f. angustifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaf boxwood, is a compact, evergreen shrub native to China. It features dense, dark green foliage with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that give it a formal appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers in spring, followed by orange-red蒴果 that split open to release seeds. It is widely used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to tolerate修剪. Due to its slow growth and compact form, it is ideal for foundation plantings and topiary.
